page.title: 03SOUTH FARM - LAND USE
page.content: The 500 acres of land is split into 2 main uses:arable and livestock.The crops include wheat-100 acres,oats-25 acres,barley-125 acres.Some of the crops are grown for sale,some (such as the barley) kept for fodder.Oats are a new crop which the farmer is trying for the first time in 1985.Animals include 250-300 beef cattle, 100 dairy cows (Freisian) and some sheep, all of which graze on 250 acres. Scotch half breeds and Suffolk Cross are two types of sheep being grazed.The approximate yield from the dairy cattle is 310 gallons of milk a day. This milk is regularly collected from the farm by milk tanker and taken to the depot in Portsmouth, where it is treated and distributed nationwide.The beef cattle and lambs are fattened on the farm and then taken for slaughter at the abattoir in Petersfield.
